queries.query_description: Ensures clean state by dropping database from any previous failed run

queries.query_string: CREATE DATABASE ato_test_db; \c ato_test_db; CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS object1 (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, data VARCHAR(100), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP); CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS object2 (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, data VARCHAR(100), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP); CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS object3 (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, data VARCHAR(100), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP); CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS object4 (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, data VARCHAR(100), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP); CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS object5 (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, data VARCHAR(100), created_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP)
queries.query_usecase: Create ATO Test Database and 5 Objects
queries.query_description: Creates test database and 5 objects (tables) for Account Takeover testing

queries.query_string: INSERT INTO object1 (data) VALUES (CONCAT('Object1 Data ', gen_random_uuid()::text)); INSERT INTO object2 (data) VALUES (CONCAT('Object2 Data ', gen_random_uuid()::text)); INSERT INTO object3 (data) VALUES (CONCAT('Object3 Data ', gen_random_uuid()::text)); INSERT INTO object4 (data) VALUES (CONCAT('Object4 Data ', gen_random_uuid()::text)); INSERT INTO object5 (data) VALUES (CONCAT('Object5 Data ', gen_random_uuid()::text))
queries.query_usecase: Insert Test Data into All Objects
queries.query_description: Insert 1000 records into each of the 5 objects

queries.query_string: SELECT * FROM object1 WHERE id = FLOOR(1 + RANDOM() * 1000) LIMIT 10
queries.query_description: Hour 1 baseline - 50 SELECTs on object1 (normal user behavior)

queries.query_string: SELECT * FROM object1 WHERE id = FLOOR(1 + RANDOM() * 1000) LIMIT 10
queries.query_description: Hour 2 baseline - 50 SELECTs on object1 (normal user behavior)

queries.query_string: SELECT * FROM object1 WHERE id = FLOOR(1 + RANDOM() * 1000) LIMIT 10
queries.query_description: Hour 3 baseline - 50 SELECTs on object1 (normal user behavior)

queries.query_string: SELECT * FROM object1 WHERE id = FLOOR(1 + RANDOM() * 1000) LIMIT 10
queries.query_description: Hour 4 baseline - 50 SELECTs on object1 (normal user behavior)

queries.query_string: SELECT * FROM object1 WHERE id = FLOOR(1 + RANDOM() * 1000) LIMIT 10
queries.query_description: HOUR 5 ANOMALY: Sudden access to all 5 objects (50 SELECTs each = 250 total) - Account Takeover pattern

queries.query_string: SELECT * FROM object2 WHERE id = FLOOR(1 + RANDOM() * 1000) LIMIT 10
queries.query_description: Part of ATO spike - accessing object2 (never accessed before)

queries.query_string: SELECT * FROM object3 WHERE id = FLOOR(1 + RANDOM() * 1000) LIMIT 10
queries.query_description: Part of ATO spike - accessing object3 (never accessed before)

queries.query_string: SELECT * FROM object4 WHERE id = FLOOR(1 + RANDOM() * 1000) LIMIT 10
queries.query_description: Part of ATO spike - accessing object4 (never accessed before)

queries.query_string: SELECT * FROM object5 WHERE id = FLOOR(1 + RANDOM() * 1000) LIMIT 10
queries.query_description: Part of ATO spike - accessing object5 (never accessed before)

queries.query_string: SELECT 'object1' as table_name, COUNT(*) as record_count FROM object1 UNION SELECT 'object2', COUNT(*) FROM object2 UNION SELECT 'object3', COUNT(*) FROM object3 UNION SELECT 'object4', COUNT(*) FROM object4 UNION SELECT 'object5', COUNT(*) FROM object5
queries.query_description: Verify record counts in all 5 objects
